com.percussion.util
Class PSLineBreaker

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.util.PSLineBreaker

public class PSLineBreaker
extends Object

This class is used to break a string up into lines with a length not more than a specified width, breaking the line at the first embedded new line or a whitespace or dash that is found closest to the end of the line and is within a given threshold.

Constructor Detail

PSLineBreaker

PSLineBreaker

public PSLineBreaker(String line,
                     int maxLen,
                     int threshold,
                     String newLine)
Constructor for this class that takes an additional newLine string

Parameters:
line - the line to break. May not be null.
maxLen - the max length of each line to return. Must be greater than zero.
threshold - number of chars counting from the end of line to check for a whitespace or dash. If none is found within a given threshold and a line doesn't already contain new lines, then the line will break precisely at the specified maxLen. The embedded newLine overrides a threshold restriction causing the line to break at the embedded new line which is found to be closest to the beginning of the line. In case if multiple new lines are found next to one another it results in one empty string collected for the each new line found. If NO new lines were found, then it looks for a dash or space. If both dash and space are found within the threshold then it picks the one, which index is closest to the end of the line. Threshold value MUST be greater than zero and less than maxLen. Usage examples / tests can be found in the main method of this class.
newLine - new line string to take into account when breaking lines, for backward compatibility if null or empty is passed then assumes newLine = "\r\n"
Method Detail

wrapString

public static String wrapString(String line,
                                int maxLen,
                                int threshold,
                                String newLine)
Instantiates a PSLineBreaker, then recombines the lines into a single string, adding newlines after each line (except the last). See ctor for details on params.

Parameters:
newLine - Added whereever a break is found and a line follows. If null or empty, "\r\n" is used.
Returns:
The supplied string, with newlines added at appropriate break points. Never null.

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Checks to see if more lines will be returned.

Returns:
true if there are more lines, false if no more lines are available.

next

public String next()
Returns the next line.

Returns:
the next line. Use hasNext to determine if there are more lines.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if no more lines are available.

maxLength

public int maxLength()
Returns the length of the longest line.

Returns:
the length

getLines

public String[] getLines()
Return the split lines as an array of strings

Returns:
String array after breaking, never null or empty.
